storyTitle: As Manager, I want to assign deadlines to tasks to achieve timely completion

testCases.title: Validate successful deadline assignment with future date
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
At least one task exists in the system
Task is accessible to the manager
System time is synchronized and accurate
At least one employee is assigned to the task

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page and select an existing task
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed with task information

steps.action: Click on the deadline update or edit button
steps.expectedResult: Deadline input form is displayed with date and time picker fields

steps.action: Enter a valid future date (e.g., 7 days from current date) in the date field
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and displayed in the date field without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a valid future time in the time field
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and displayed in the time field without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button to save the deadline update
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Observe the response after submission
steps.expectedResult: Deadline is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed to the manager (e.g., 'Deadline updated successfully'), and response time is under 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the task details page shows the updated deadline
steps.expectedResult: Task details display the newly assigned deadline date and time correctly

steps.action: Check the notification system for assigned employees
steps.expectedResult: All assigned employees receive notifications about the deadline assignment

postconditions: Deadline is persistently saved in the task database
Task details reflect the updated deadline
Notifications are sent to all assigned employees
Manager receives confirmation of successful update
Task status remains unchanged unless modified

testCases.title: Verify rejection of past date deadline assignment
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
At least one task exists in the system
Task is accessible to the manager
System time is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page and select an existing task
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed with task information

steps.action: Click on the deadline update or edit button
steps.expectedResult: Deadline input form is displayed with date and time picker fields

steps.action: Enter a past date (e.g., yesterday's date) in the date field
steps.expectedResult: Date is entered in the field

steps.action: Enter a time in the time field
steps.expectedResult: Time is entered in the field

steps.action: Observe the validation behavior after entering the past date
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating that the deadline cannot be in the past (e.g., 'Deadline must be a future date and time')

steps.action: Attempt to click the Submit or Save button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked and the form does not submit; error message remains visible

steps.action: Clear the past date and enter a valid future date and time
steps.expectedResult: Validation error disappears and input is accepted without errors

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button with valid future date
steps.expectedResult: Form submits successfully and confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: No deadline is saved when past date is entered
Task deadline remains unchanged from previous valid value or remains empty
No notifications are sent to employees for invalid submission
System maintains data integrity by preventing invalid deadline values

testCases.title: Ensure notifications are sent upon deadline update
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
At least one task exists with multiple employees assigned
Task is accessible to the manager
Notification system is operational
Assigned employees have valid notification settings enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page and select a task that has employees assigned
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed showing assigned employees

steps.action: Click on the deadline update or edit button
steps.expectedResult: Deadline input form is displayed

steps.action: Enter a valid future date and time for the deadline
steps.expectedResult: Date and time are accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button to update the deadline
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Observe the confirmation message displayed to the manager
steps.expectedResult: Deadline update is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Deadline updated successfully and notifications sent')

steps.action: Access the notification system or notification logs
steps.expectedResult: Notification system shows records of notifications being sent

steps.action: Verify that all assigned employees received the deadline update notification
steps.expectedResult: All assigned employees have received notifications containing the updated deadline information

steps.action: Check the notification content for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Notification includes task name, updated deadline date and time, and manager who made the update

steps.action: Verify the manager sees the confirmation message on the task page
steps.expectedResult: Manager sees confirmation of successful update with indication that notifications were sent

postconditions: Deadline is saved in the database
All assigned employees have received notifications
Notification delivery rate meets 95% success metric
Manager has confirmation of successful operation
Notification logs are updated with delivery status

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to set task priority levels to achieve effective task scheduling

testCases.title: Validate successful priority assignment with valid value
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
At least one task exists in the system
Task is accessible to the manager
Priority levels are predefined in the system (High, Medium, Low)
At least one employee is assigned to the task

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page and select an existing task
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed with task information

steps.action: Click on the priority update or edit button
steps.expectedResult: Priority selection form is displayed with a dropdown containing predefined priority levels (High, Medium, Low)

steps.action: Click on the priority dropdown to view available options
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands showing all predefined priority levels: High, Medium, and Low

steps.action: Select 'High' priority level from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selection is accepted, 'High' is displayed in the dropdown field, and no validation errors appear

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button to save the priority update
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Observe the response after submission
steps.expectedResult: Priority is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed to the manager (e.g., 'Priority updated successfully'), and response time is under 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the task details page shows the updated priority
steps.expectedResult: Task details display the newly assigned priority level 'High' correctly with appropriate visual indicator

steps.action: Check the notification system for assigned employees
steps.expectedResult: All assigned employees receive notifications about the priority update

postconditions: Priority is persistently saved in the task database
Task details reflect the updated priority level
Notifications are sent to all assigned employees
Manager receives confirmation of successful update
Task priority is visible in task lists and detail views

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid priority values
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role
At least one task exists in the system
Task is accessible to the manager
System has validation rules for priority values

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page and select an existing task
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed with task information

steps.action: Click on the priority update or edit button
steps.expectedResult: Priority selection form is displayed with dropdown field

steps.action: Attempt to manually enter an invalid priority value (e.g., 'Critical' or 'Urgent') if the field allows text input, or inspect the dropdown for invalid options
steps.expectedResult: If text input is possible, invalid value is entered; if dropdown only, no invalid options are available

steps.action: If invalid value was entered, observe the validation behavior
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating that the priority value is invalid (e.g., 'Please select a valid priority level: High, Medium, or Low')

steps.action: Attempt to click the Submit or Save button with invalid priority
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked and the form does not submit; error message remains visible

steps.action: Clear the invalid value and select a valid priority level from the dropdown (e.g., 'Medium')
steps.expectedResult: Validation error disappears and selection is accepted without errors

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button with valid priority selection
steps.expectedResult: Form submits successfully and confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: No priority is saved when invalid value is entered
Task priority remains unchanged from previous valid value or remains empty
No notifications are sent to employees for invalid submission
System maintains data integrity by preventing invalid priority values
Validation rules are enforced at 100% rate
